alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 2:12PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Scotts Bluff, northwestern Banner, southern Goshen, northeastern Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 211 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Hawk Springs, or 26 miles southwest of Torrington, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lingle, La Grange, Yoder, Huntley, Hawk Springs Campground, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Veteran and Hawk Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County
